title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:37 <Denis> has quit  
01:51 <+cjdelisle> 12:48 < vmassol> cjdelisle: do you recall if the captch for unreg users on comments is on by default?  
01:52 <+cjdelisle> that is a no.  
01:53 <+cjdelisle> In order to enable it on every wiki (I assume that's what you are thinking) you would have to first check that the XWikiPreferences class property is there then you would have to set that property true in each XWikiPreferences document.  
02:19 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
02:19 <abusenius> has quit  
02:21 <abusenius\_> is now known as <abusenius>  
02:29 <DrLou> has quit  
03:38 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
03:39 <venkatesh> has quit  
05:07 <abusenius> has quit  
05:08 <sburjan`> has quit  
06:22 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
07:20 <phancox> has joined #xwiki  
07:21 <phancox> Does anyone have experience with using XWiki in Chrome browser?  
07:22 <+cjdelisle> I do not and other developers will be here in 2 hours so if you stick around you can ask them.  
07:23 <phancox> Thanks.  I've been using Firefox until now.  Seem to be a few niggly problems with Chrome  
07:23 <phancox> I've searched the mailing lists.  Any suggestions where else to look  
07:24 <+cjdelisle> you could do a search against jira.xwiki.org  
07:24 <phancox> thanks.  was just off looking for the bug list  
07:25 <+cjdelisle> I know there are some developers and testers who have used it. Also if you have found something previously undiscovered it would be great if you could report it.  
07:26 <phancox> will do.  Meta+G is captured by Chrome so I need to remap it in one of them,  Panel wizard won't expand the available panels  
07:30 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:32 <vmassol> has quit  
07:33 <phancox> Panel wizard bug is fixed in 3.0M3  
08:49 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:06 <vmassol> goooooood morrrrrrnnnnnniiinnnng xwiki!  
09:07 <vmassol> (voice of good morning vietnam)  
09:11 <phancox> has left #xwiki  
09:12 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <+cjdelisle> 20:56 <+cjdelisle> 12:48 < vmassol> cjdelisle: do you recall if the captch for unreg users on comments is on by  default?  
09:28 <+cjdelisle> 20:57 <+cjdelisle> that is a no.  
09:28 <+cjdelisle> 20:58 <+cjdelisle> In order to enable it on every wiki (I assume that's what you are thinking) you would have to first  check that the XWikiPreferences class property is there then you would have to set that property  true in each XWikiPreferences document.  
09:41 <vmassol> cjdelisle: ok thanks. We probably need some kind of "xwiki flavor" configuration. flavor 1: use XE internally, flavor 2: use XE in an open site  
09:42 <+cjdelisle> It would be easy except for the fact that it is a farm.  
09:53 <+cjdelisle> Going to be adventrous and see if I can start jetty from the test initializer. It would be awesome to be able to test apis in a running wiki.  
09:53 <vmassol> that's what we do in all func tests  
09:54 <vmassol> (start xwikii from the junit test)  
09:54 <+cjdelisle> But in the same process  
09:54 <+cjdelisle> So I can directly call apis.  
10:00 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <vmassol> lucaa: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-6135  
10:31 <+lucaa> thanks!  
10:40 <kwoot> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <kwoot> hello all. I am at this moment giving a training in using xwiki. The page watchlist button does not seem to work in IE 7. It works in FF. Can you help me?  
10:42 <vmassol> kwoot: might depend on the XE version you're using. Does it work in 3.0M3?  
10:43 <kwoot> Our production server runs 2.6.33065  
10:45 <kwoot> off course there is always the possibility that I don't know what I am doing :-)  
10:46 <kwoot> Then again; on ubuntu firefox it works great!  
10:48 <vmassol> kwoot: what I'm saying is that maybe this was fixed in later versions  
10:48 <vmassol> (I have no idea though)  
10:48 <vmassol> have you searched xwiki's jira?  
10:50 <vmassol> myxwiki.org is still up and it's still fast! :)  
10:50 <+sburjan`> hello :)  
10:51 <ihalip\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:51 <ihalip\_> has quit  
10:51 <ihalip\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:52 <phancox> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <phancox> has left #xwiki  
10:55 <ihalip\_> has quit  
10:55 <ihalip> has quit  
11:00 <ihalip> has joined #xwiki  
11:00 <ihalip> has quit  
11:00 <ihalip> has joined #xwiki  
11:03 <kwoot> vmassol: For the moment we'll have to use our version. This is a company that does not upgrade more than once a year.  
11:04 <vmassol> kwoot: I'm not sure what your question is  
11:04 <vmassol> if the issue is fixed i later version then the answer is to upgrade or you backport the patch in your version  
11:04 <vmassol> s/i later/in later/  
11:05 <vmassol> we don't support 2.6 anymore here  
11:05 <vmassol> only 2.7 and 3.0  
11:05 <vmassol> the community's official rule is to support the last 2 releases  
11:05 <vmassol> now  
11:05 <vmassol> if someone can help you then great  
11:05 <vmassol> I don't know this problem personally  
11:06 <vmassol> so all I was suggesting was verifying if it's been fixed already  
11:06 <vmassol> I'll let others chime in if they have more info  
11:06 <+cjdelisle> heh trying to start jetty from the test process --> fail  
11:16 <+sburjan`> vmassol: I am gonna test WYSIWYG Admin Section. Could you test Search Suggest and Extension Manager because I don't know If I'll be able to do these before release on Monday ?  
11:16 <vmassol> ok  
11:16 <vmassol> tmortagne: is ext manager ok now for retest?  
11:17 <+tmortagne> vmassol: is was yesterday already but you have to so to XWiki/ExtensionManager page  
11:18 <+tmortagne> because of XAADMINISTRATION-258  
11:18 <+tmortagne> s/so/go/  
11:18 <vmassol> tmortagne: can we fix this before 3.0 final?  
11:19 <vmassol> question for cjdelisle too I guess  
11:19 <+cjdelisle> Yes, comment out line 37 and hope noone figures it out.  
11:19 <vmassol> in the meantime I'll test ext manager going to that page directly  
11:19 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I mean a commit for 3.0 final :  
11:19 <vmassol> :)  
11:21 <vmassol> tmortagne: (3.0-SNAPSHOT was 2.2.5)  
11:21 <vmassol> means that the version found is 3.0-SNAPSHOT  
11:21 <vmassol> and the dep says 2.2.5  
11:21 <vmassol> ?  
11:22 <+cjdelisle> If I would look at using parseGroovyFromPage to execute code that we know to be safe and which requires PR from an unsafe environment. Barring that all I can think is to stop dropping permissions which you do at your risk.  
11:23 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yes mean that there is already a core extension in 3.0-SNAPSHOT and that will be used instead of the needed 2.2.5  
11:26 <+tmortagne> extension manager takes dependencies version as "version and more" for now  
11:27 <vmassol> ok  
11:28 <vmassol> works well so far, very cool! :)  
11:28 <vmassol> it's going to kick ass with a nice UI  
11:28 <+tmortagne> hope so  
11:28 <+tmortagne> :)  
11:29 <+tmortagne> wait that jvelociter start working on extension manager ;)  
11:29 <vmassol> let me rephrase that  
11:29 <vmassol> it's going to kick ass with a nice UI and the list of available extensions listed  
11:29 <vmassol> :)  
11:30 <vmassol> can you do that already? (list all avail extensions)  
11:30 <+tmortagne> yea and a repository cache too  
11:30 <+tmortagne> to search extensions etc...  
11:30 <+tmortagne> that's not easy currently  
11:30 <+tmortagne> with pure maven/aether it's not really possible I think (without nexus index)  
11:31 <+tmortagne> but i will find something don't worry  
11:31 <+tmortagne> but there some design work to support it properly with good speed  
11:31 <+tmortagne> i.e. a local database with all repositories, apt-get style  
11:32 <+tmortagne> ha yes forgot the screenshot thanks  
11:32 <fmancinelli> Hi all. Is there a technique to "pass" some parameters to an included JSX?  
11:33 <sburjan`> has quit  
11:33 <+tmortagne> vmassol: you have virtual=1 ?  
11:33 <vmassol> no  
11:34 <+tmortagne> then you are not using the last trunk or i forgot to commit something  
11:34 <vmassol> I svn upped 1 hour ago  
11:34 <+tmortagne> since i see you have Extension wiki in your screenshot  
11:34 <vmassol> and rebuilt the whole thing  
11:34 <+tmortagne> ok lets check  
11:36 <vmassol> tmortagne: what is "Guessed third party core extensions" ?  
11:36 <+tmortagne> vmassol: usually that's core jar i found in the classpath for which i'm not 100% sure about the version because there was no proper pom.xml provided  
11:37 <+tmortagne> it's the "ok lest try to guess what we have already" section  
11:37 <vmassol> so how do you guess the version?  
11:38 <+tmortagne> some jingling with jar name and others core extension dependencies versions  
11:38 <vmassol> hmm I see a pom here: http://repo2.maven.org/maven2/org/codehaus/groovy/groovy-all/1.7.7/  
11:38 <+tmortagne> let me find you the core  
11:38 <vmassol> but groovy-all appears in the guessed section  
11:39 <+tmortagne> that's core extensions  
11:39 <+tmortagne> when i say no pom i mean in the jar file  
11:39 <vmassol> oh ok  
11:39 <vmassol> so all artifacts not built by maven  
11:39 <vmassol> (at least)  
11:40 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
11:40 <+tmortagne> all not installed by extension manager  
11:40 <vmassol> s/at least/at most/  
11:40 <+tmortagne> basically everything that is in the classpath  
11:40 <vmassol> I see the xwiki jars are not in the guessed section and there are quite a few not in the guess section either  
11:40 <+tmortagne> most of them comes from maven repository soemwhere but we can know than only if they contains a pom.xml  
11:40 <+tmortagne> yep  
11:41 <+tmortagne> i was suprised too, was expecting a worst result  
11:41 <vmassol> i mean you said "all not installed by extension manager", those were not istalled by the ext manager  
11:41 <vmassol> trying to understand  
11:41 <+tmortagne> why xwiki would be in guess section ?  
11:41 <+tmortagne> it's not guessed since they provide a proper pom.xml  
11:41 <+tmortagne> all of them  
11:42 <vmassol> ok that's what i understood initially  
11:42 <vmassol> then you said "all not installed by extension manager" and that confused me  
11:42 <+tmortagne> plus i separated xwiki from the rest in the xwiki section  
11:42 <+tmortagne> it's not  
11:42 <+tmortagne> did you installed the rendering with extension manager ?  
11:43 <vmassol> I didn't install groovy-all either  
11:43 <+tmortagne> yes that's what i'm saying...  
11:43 <vmassol> ok I think I understand  
11:43 <+tmortagne> core extension are extension not installed by extension manager  
11:43 <+tmortagne> all of them  
11:43 <+tmortagne> xwiki one included  
11:44 <vmassol> going to try an upgrade now  
11:44 <+tmortagne> then in core extension you have xwiki extension, extension which provide proper pom.xml and some gray area for others  
11:44 <vmassol> if we wanted we could do on the remote repo to check their pom.xml I guess  
11:44 <vmassol> s/do/go/  
11:45 <vmassol> (could be improvement for later)  
11:45 <+tmortagne> yes but for now i did not want to make core repository depends on some specific repository that is supposed to be an extension  
11:45 <+tmortagne> i think the best is to build the list at build time  
11:45 <+tmortagne> that's the only safe way  
11:46 <+tmortagne> since there is jar in there for which i don't even have any idea what is the groupid  
11:46 <vmassol> you can find that from the xwiki jars poms  
11:46 <+tmortagne> i don't have them  
11:46 <vmassol> transitive resolving  
11:46 <+tmortagne> of what ?  
11:46 <vmassol> you have the xwiki jar poms since the poms are in the jars  
11:46 <+tmortagne> i don't have XE pom.xml for example  
11:47 <vmassol> ah  
11:47 <+tmortagne> same for any war project  
11:47 <vmassol> you have the war apparently  
11:47 <vmassol> I see it listed  
11:47 <+tmortagne> and there is a lot of things directly in web-standard  
11:47 <vmassol> maybe it's noather one  
11:47 <+tmortagne> which war ?  
11:47 <vmassol> yes it's noather one  
11:47 <vmassol> not the standard one  
11:47 <+tmortagne> you have a war in the classpath ?  
11:47 <vmassol> yes that looks strange  
11:48 <+tmortagne> that's weird  
11:48 <+tmortagne> using tomcat ?  
11:48 <vmassol> com.xpn.xwiki.platform:xwiki-web-gwt-wysiwyg-server  
11:48 <vmassol> 3.0-SNAPSHOT  
11:48 <vmassol> war  
11:48 <+tmortagne> hmm  
11:48 <+tmortagne> looks like we have some issue here  
11:48 <+tmortagne> checking the distribution  
11:49 <+tmortagne> this xar should have been merged in web-standard i think  
11:49 <+tmortagne> war  
11:49 <+tmortagne> otherwise it's a jar  
11:50 <+tmortagne> that's another benefit of extensions manager core extension section, we see some interesting things :)  
11:54 <vmassol> yes  
11:54 <vmassol> it's a nice page (and worrying too on some aspect) to see all that xwiki is using  
11:54 <+tmortagne> yea it's a big page :)  
11:55 <+jvelociter> fmancinelli: pass to JS or to velocity ?  
11:56 <fmancinelli> jvelociter: both are fine, the JS is interpreted so I can rewrite velocity to JS  
11:56 <+jvelociter> always-used JSX or on demand ?  
11:56 <vmassol> jvdrean: "watchlist test email notifier" is to send the mail immediatly?  
11:56 <+jvelociter> on demand you can do :  
11:56 <+jvelociter> $xwiki.jsx.use("My.JSX", {})  
11:56 <+jvelociter> sorry  
11:57 <vmassol> jvdrean: is it sent once only?  
11:57 <+jvelociter> $xwiki.jsx.use("My.JSX", { "myRequestParam" : "myValue"})  
11:57 <fmancinelli> jvelociter: cool  
11:58 <+jvelociter> (can be used for tweaking caching for example)  
11:58 <fmancinelli> jvelociter: and in the included JSX what's the name that map is bound to?  
11:58 <+jvelociter> it's request params  
11:58 <+jvelociter> $request.myRequestParam  
11:59 <fmancinelli> jvelociter: I see :) Exactly what I was looking for ;)  
11:59 <+jvelociter> cool  
11:59 <+jvelociter> :)  
11:59 <fmancinelli> jvelociter: 10x  
12:07 <+jvdrean> vmassol: "watchlist test email notifier" can be deleted  
12:14 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
12:18 <vmassol> jvdrean: ok creating a jira and removing it  
12:18 <vmassol> jvdrean: any easy way for me to trigger sending the watchlist?  
12:19 <vmassol> ah it's not in XE jiust on myxwiki  
12:19 <+jvdrean> indeed  
12:19 <vmassol> ok understand now  
12:19 <vmassol> it sends every 5 minutes  
12:20 <vmassol> ok got it  
12:20 <+jvdrean> you can fire one of the jobs but all the subscribers in all wikis will receive notifications (if any)  
12:20 <+jvdrean> that's why there was this test job  
12:20 <+jvdrean> to be able to test the watchlist without impacting users  
12:20 <vmassol> ok I can use it  
12:20 <vmassol> thanks

12:58 <phancox1> Does anyone know if it's possible to change the Meta+G key binding in XWiki?  
12:59 <phancox1> I'm planning on switching from Firefox to Chrome and Chrome captures the Ctrl+G key.

14:38 <vmassol> tmortagne: just tested more of the extension manager  
14:38 <vmassol> I installed BulletinBoard v 1.1 (http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/contrib/xwiki-application-bulletinboard/)  
14:38 <vmassol> then v 1.2  
14:38 <vmassol> question: the EM lists both as being installed, is that normal?  
14:39 <vmassol> then when I removed v1.2 it removed both versions but the EM UI still listed both versions as still installed  
14:41 <+tmortagne> vmassol: no it's not normal but i think i just forgot to remove the installed flag when upgrading  
14:41 <+tmortagne> it's normal that it's keeped in the local repository but should not be indicated as installed  
14:41 <+tmortagne> let me see  
14:50 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yep that was it, forgot to untag install for the previous extension, fixing that now  
14:51 <vmassol> ok  
14:51 <vmassol> the fact that it removes all previous version is a known limitation right?  
14:54 <kwoot> has quit  
15:02 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
15:08 <vmassol> reminder to self: we need to fix the mac build issue  
15:10 <vmassol> (that's what got me and why the user avatar thing wasn't working for me)  
15:13 <+cjdelisle> I have a "configuration profile" which has methods to apply and remove itself. Now I'm trying ti figure out how to make all ot the tests run with each existing profile. Any hints?

16:37 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Are all these versions of jmock needed? jmock:jmock, jmock:jmock-cglib, org.jmock:jmock-junit4  
16:37 <vmassol> sdumitriu: yes  
16:37 <@sdumitriu> Why?  
16:37 <vmassol> they're 3 diffrent things  
16:38 <vmassol> jmock can be used without junit  
16:38 <vmassol> and the cglib one is for imposterizing classes  
16:46 <lucaa> has quit

16:57 <vmassol> jvelociter: you know that the current UI is not the one we want to use right (for extension manager) and that caty has done a mockup right? (just making sure)  
16:57 <vmassol> s/use right/use/  
16:57 <+jvelociter> vmassol: yeah sure  
16:57 <vmassol> ok :)  
16:57 <+jvelociter> but there is quite some work to be done before we get there  
16:57 <vmassol> was just a quick improvement that'll be discarded later on then  
16:58 <+jvelociter> actually, caty's work is on a "marketplace" UI  
16:58 <+jvelociter> we might need a standard extension management UI as well  
16:59 <+jvelociter> but anyway, here I was just doing a quick relooking of the form so it looks better for 3.0  
16:59 <vmassol> ok
